summary: I managed to make a few modifications for a better experience as a mage, but also keeping the game balanced. 3 New Spells. Better Destruction Spells. Better Gauldur Amulet etc.
descriptionHtml:
The Mage Path

I managed to make a few modifications for a better experience as a mage, but also keeping the game balanced (except for the \"Deep Focus Spell\" that I created, but you can ignore the tome and never use it).


=================
Requirements:
=================

Skyrim

=================
Description:
=================


Bound Sword 300 seconds
Soultrap last 1 day
Daedric Artifacts no recharge
Buffed Up Archmage Robe (150% Magicka Regeneration)
Gauldur Amulet Buffed (M 200 H 200 S 200)
Sarthaal Amulet buffed (from 3% to 15%)
Wards cost lowered considerably

Nigh Eye Spell Tome + Deep Focus Spell Tome (Lesser Power 600 Mp for 3 min) + Spectral Arrow Tome (the spell existed, but was not implemented into the vanila game, so I did) in the Arcanaeum.

Dragonskin lasts 12 hours

Buffed up Destruction spells from Adept, Expert and Master levels (the game it\'s 
still balanced, but now the spells are more damaging and appropriate to their mastery level)

Buffed up Bound Weapon (so it deals a little bit more damage)

=================
Installation
=================

Manual Download with NMM

    1. Start NMM and click on Mods.

    2. In the left icon bar, click on Add Mod From File and select the downloaded 

archive file.

    3. The Mage Path will now appear in the list. Double-click to Activate it.
 
   Done!

OR

Manual Installation without NMM


    1. Locate the Data/ folder in your Skyrim installation directory. Typically it\'s 

found at Program Files/Steam/steamapps/common/skyrim/Data/.

    2. Extract the contents of the downloaded archive file to your Data/ folder.

    3. Start Skyrim Launcher

    4. Select Data Files

    5. Activate the The Mage Path.esp

    Done!

=================
Un-Installation:
=================

1. Delete the files/folders associated with the mod
2. Uncheck the The Mage Path.esp is checked in the Launcher


I hope you enjoy!
